On Windows, other then on Mac, the Work Offline option is located under the Web Developer sub menu of the the File top level menu. This is not the ideal location for this option as this feature is not targeted only at web developers and the casual will not go hunting for it there.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Click on File
2. Then Web Developer
3. Offline Mode is last option

Actual Results:  
see details

Expected Results:  
I would expect the Work Offline menu option to be directly under the File menu i.e. File > Work Offline and not File > Web Developer > Work Offline
comments.author: volume4.schalk@gmail.com

comments.raw_text:
There are quite a lots of people - including me - having valid uses of "Work off-line" that are not for Web development. We have a few examples of these in file bug 598719.

In Firefox 26 on Win 7 I DO HAVE "Work off-line" in the menu File.

In fact, I even miss the socket from good old Communicator : it was a button at the bottom-right of the window. With it, it was an easy way to : 
 - Switch between off-line and on-line. 
 - AND to know in which mode we are.
